intro: Sphaerosacme polystachya, commonly known as the velvetleaf or wild spinach, is a tropical herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, followed by kidney-shaped seeds. It is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils. Botanically, it belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
